channel.title: EasyRSC Q's
channel.description: Is there a zoom command on the EasyRSC client? And also, once I port forward my server, I find my default gateway Ip and then set it as the client settings.ini?

item.title: EasyRSC Q's
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

CarsonClassic:

Is there a zoom command on the EasyRSC client? And also, once I port forward my server, I find my default gateway Ip and then set it as the client settings.ini?

When you portforward, you type default gateway ip into browser and then you can access the router, which is where you do the ‘port forward’ stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Q's
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

Depending on which easyrsc source you are using there is a zoom function in yongs noobscape’s versions, I think if i remember correctly its page up and page down to use it…

Once you have port forwarded you will need your ip that can be found by using sites like whatismyip.com and place that in your settings.ini client side…
Make sure you have your routers ip eg 192.168.1.25 in your server class which is server side.

Hope this helps

Read full topic
